definition: to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

sentences.english: He al ays makes full preparations for his classes and corrects our home ork carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他总是认真备课，认真批改作业。

sentences.english: He always makes full preparations for his classes and corrects our homework carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他总是认真备课，认真批改作业。

sentences.english: Provide the FT with all materials required to prepare and teach lessons.
sentences.chinese: 为外师提供备课和教课所需材料。

sentences.english: There're many computers in the lesson-preparing office.
sentences.chinese: 在我们备课室里有许多电脑。

sentences.english: He often makes full preparations for his class and corrects our home ork carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他经常认真备课，认真为我们批改作业。

sentences.english: Consider the language output when you plan.
sentences.chinese: 备课时要先考虑语言的输出。

sentences.english: To prepare lessons before class and organize interaction activities with parents and students.
sentences.chinese: 组织备课和与家长学生互动活动。

sentences.english: Between classes the Senior 1 English Office is a mad-house.
sentences.chinese: 课间高一英语备课组的办公室热闹得掀开了锅。

sentences.english: He often makes full preparations for his class and corrects our homework carefully.
sentences.chinese: 经常认真备课，认真们批改作业。

sentences.english: At the moment, Mr. Chen preparing for lesson worried about another problem.
sentences.chinese: 此时此刻，正在备课的陈老师担忧着另外的问题。

sentences.english: And I will have three classes tomorrow morning. There is no enough time left for me.
sentences.chinese: 而明天早上我有三节课，剩下的时间不够备课。

sentences.english: Where am I coming here when I think about this course?
sentences.chinese: 备课时我想和大家说些什么呢？

sentences.english: Night you are still seriously preparing lessons.
sentences.chinese: 深夜里您还在认真地备课。

sentences.english: The present invention relates to a kind of printed matter-textbook with pages for preparing lessons.
sentences.chinese: 本发明涉及一种印刷品即带备课页的教本。
